alert.note: Alert for Western Chester; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Montgomery and west central Bucks Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 243 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm near Pottstown, or 19 miles east of Reading, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pottstown, Lansdale, Perkasie, Souderton, Collegeville, Trappe, Hatfield, Schwenksville, Green Lane, Spring Mount, Gilbertsville, Cedarville, Skippack, Stowe, Telford, Sellersville, North Wales, Silverdale, Harleysville and Pottsgrove. This includes Northeast Extension between mile markers 26 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
